definitions.definition: Arousing doubt ; questionable ; open to suspicion .
examples: After he made some dubious claims about the company, fewer people trusted him.
They were renowned as people of dubious morals.
definitions.label_groups: of a statement, matter, or thing

definitions.definition: In disbelief ; wavering , uncertain, or hesitating in opinion; inclined to doubt; undecided .
Generally considered imprecise or wrong , but not totally unplayable .
definitions.label_groups: chess , chiefly of an opening move

main_definition: ( of a statement, matter, or thing ) Arousing doubt ; questionable ; open to suspicion .
secondary_definitions: ( of a person ) In disbelief ; wavering , uncertain, or hesitating in opinion; inclined to doubt; undecided .
( chess , chiefly of an opening move ) Generally considered imprecise or wrong , but not totally unplayable .
